steps.title: Rest Your Body
steps.subtitle: Get plenty of sleep. Avoid sports or heavy activity. Let your body focus on healing.

steps.title: Stay Hydrated
steps.subtitle: Drink water, soup, or warm drinks. Small sips are okay if you don’t feel well. Fluids help specifically with fever and congestion.

steps.title: Manage Fever & Aches
steps.subtitle: Use fever-reducing medicine only as directed by a parent or doctor. Dress in light clothing. Lukewarm showers can help comfort.

steps.title: Ease Breathing & Congestion
steps.subtitle: Use a humidifier or warm showers. Rest with your head slightly raised.  Blow your nose gently and often.

steps.title: Prevent Spreading Illness
steps.subtitle: Stay home. Cover coughs. Wash hands often. Wear a mask if advised.

steps.title: Know When to Get Help
steps.subtitle: Get help if symptoms worsen or don’t improve. Seek hospital care for trouble breathing, chest pain, or high fever. Call Emergency Medical Services for advanced Medical Care.
